---
title: "Illustrations for Publications: Data Management Tutorials"
---

These are the tutorials for the "open science theory and practice" part of the course "Data Handling and High-Quality Illustrations for Publications".

# Prerequisites: 

You will need a `github account`, an installation of `R` and `RStudio`, and you will have to have git set-up in your RStudio. 

# Setting up git for rstudio

## Install git

First, you will need to install git on your local machine:

[Instructions on how to install git](https://happygitwithr.com/install-git)

## Configure git in Rstudio

Then, you need to configure git in your Rstudio:

[Instructions on how to configure git in Rstudio](https://happygitwithr.com/hello-git)

## Set up keys for SSH access

To be able to push changes to GitHub, you need to be able to identify you with GitHub:

[Adding a new SSH key to your GitHub account](https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/connecting-to-github-with-ssh/adding-a-new-ssh-key-to-your-github-account)

alternative information:

[Set up keys to identify yourself with github](https://happygitwithr.com/ssh-keys)
